result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey L Eastman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: 15CF113 and any other sentence currently being served.

superMiscConds.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

11/10/15 CORRECTED TO ADD THE DRGOD $10.00 SURCHARGE TO THE COURT COSTS.

May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.  Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  Must not possess or consume controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed physician. Must remain absolutely sober.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 15CF113 and any other sentence currently being served.

superTimeConds.notes:
50 hours per year while on extended supervision.
Concurrent with: 15CF113

records.addlTxt:
Clerked by AP
Defendant Casey L Eastman in court with attorney Kerry A. Kelm.  Defendant Casey L Eastman in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COURT RECORD COVERS 15CF113 AND 15CF226
3:33  State relates and gives appearances.  
3:37  State relates and gives recommendation.
3:45  Atty. Kelm makes argument.
3:53  Casey Eastman makes statement.
3:55  Court relates.

15CF113 
Count #9:  3 years Wisconsin Prision System (consecutive to any sentences currently serving) as follows:
18 months initial confinement; 18 months extended supervision.

15CF226
Count #1:  
8  years Wisconsin Prison System (to run concurrent with 15CF113 and concurrent with any time currently serving), as follows:
4 years and zero months initial confinement; 4 years and zero months extended supervision
No sentence credit for any time served.

Conditions of extended supervision:
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Remain absolutely sober.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances, unless so prescribed by licensed physician.
Perform Community Service:  50 hours per year while on extended supervision
Pay court costs and assessments.
Submit DNA samples and pay DNA surcharges
Any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up ordered by DOC

Court finds defendant is eligible for CIP and Substance Abuse Program
Voters rights given.
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence given.

Defendant Casey L Eastman in court with attorney Kerry A. Kelm.  Defendant Casey L Eastman in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
COVERS 15CF226, 13CM430, 15CF109, 15CF113.
State relates all cases to be heard together today.  
Attorney Kelm relates joint agreement on all cases.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented.  Court reviews Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights with defendant. 

15CF226:  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant and accepts waiver, finds probable cause, and binds defendant over.  Information filed.  Defendant waives reading of Information.   Defendant enters Guilty plea on Count 1.  Court accepts and finds Guilty to Count 1.  

15CF109: Court orders All Counts - DRI.

15CF113: Defendant enters Guilty Plea to Count 9.  Court accepts and finds Guilty to Count 9.  Court orders Count 10 and Count 11 - DRI.  

13CM430: Court orders DRI.

Court orders PSI.
Bond revoked.  Remanded into custody until sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF113, 15CF109, 15CF226 and 13CM430 called.  Attorney Kelm relates. Court relates. Court instructs that someone will need to either prepare a writ to have the defendant here or arrangement for him to appear by video conference.  
13CM430 - Plea hearing 8/12/15 at 3:30 pm
15CF109 and 15CF113 - Arraignment 8/12/15 at 3:30 pm
15CF226 - Initial appearance and preliminary hearing 8/12/15 at 3:30 pm

Defendant Casey L Eastman in court by video conference from Dodge Correctional with attorney Kerry A Kelm in court.  Defendant Casey L Eastman in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
13CM430, 15CF109, 15CF113 and 15CF226 called.  Attorney Kelm to forward copy of the new Complaint to her client.  All files reset -  Initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
